channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17976] HoS: don't set output collector if there's no data to process
item.description: MR doesn't set an output collector if no row is processed, i.e. ExecMapper::map is never called. Let's investigate whether Spark should do the same.
item.summary: HoS: don't set output collector if there's no data to process

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12896163 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Seems the logic should only be implemented for map work, not reduce work. For example, if we do a count() and there's no data in the table, we should return 0 instead of nothing. Therefore we should set output collector for the reduce work even if it has no data to process. MR doesn't need to do this because reducers of MR always end with operators that write to disk, e.g. FS.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12896596/HIVE-17976.2.patch

ERROR: -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 9 tests failed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12896596 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Latest failures are not related.
xuefuz, could you take a look? In summary, the patch avoids setting output collector for SparkMapRecordHandler if there's no input data, which is in line with ExecMapper. It also has some change about the logging, i.e. we can't rely on the oc to tell whether we processed any data.
lirui Thanks for working on this. I will take a look.

Patch looks good to me. +1

lirui Do you know why setting OutputConnector at init time will generate an empty row when there are no input rows? Is it due to operator.close()?
xuefuz, the empty row is generated in operator.close(). RS relies on output collector to collect the row. If we don't set output collector, the row is simply discarded by RS.
Sounds good. Thanks for the explanation, lirui.
Pushed to master. Thanks Xuefu for the review.
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
